title: Change app language to Portuguese (Brazil)

requirements.text: Update all English UI text in frontend components to Brazilian Portuguese, using the existing TRANSLATIONS constant from frontend/src/constants/translations.ts as the source of truth for all translated strings

quotes: ALTERE O IDIOMA DO APP PARA PORTUGUES - BR

acceptanceCriteria: All visible text in the application displays in Brazilian Portuguese
Form labels, placeholders, buttons, headings, and messages use the TRANSLATIONS object
No hardcoded English strings remain in component JSX
Error messages and success notifications appear in Portuguese
Help text and tooltips display in Portuguese

requirements.text: Update the PWA manifest (frontend/public/manifest.json) and HTML metadata to use Brazilian Portuguese for app name, description, and display properties

quotes: ALTERE O IDIOMA DO APP PARA PORTUGUES - BR

acceptanceCriteria: manifest.json name and short_name fields are in Portuguese
manifest.json description field is in Portuguese
HTML title tag displays Portuguese app name
Meta tags reference Portuguese content where applicable

requirements.text: Update the offline fallback page (frontend/public/offline.html) to display all text in Brazilian Portuguese, including the heading, description, and retry button

quotes: ALTERE O IDIOMA DO APP PARA PORTUGUES - BR

acceptanceCriteria: Offline page heading displays in Portuguese
Offline page description text is in Portuguese
Retry button label is in Portuguese
Page maintains the warm color palette and branding

constraints: Do not modify backend code or API responses - language changes are frontend-only
Preserve all existing functionality and user flows
Maintain the existing TRANSLATIONS constant structure in frontend/src/constants/translations.ts
Do not change any styling, colors, or visual design elements
nonGoals: Backend error messages or logging (remains in English)
Multi-language support or language switching functionality
Translation of date/time formats (already using Brazilian format)
